Complete Sentence: You may go when you have finished your work.

Additional Information

  • A modal verb is a verb that is used in combination with a normal verb.
  • 'May' is a modal verb most commonly used to express possibility (in the past, present or future). It can also be used to give or request permission, although this usage is becoming less common.

quiz.text: My Uncle Samuel ________ (be) a source of inspiration for me since I was a young boy.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'has been.'

Key Points

  • We use a Perfect tense, and not Present continuous tense, to say how long a present action or situation has been going on. It can also be detected by the usage of the conjunction 'since.'
    • For example, I've known her since 1990.
  • The given sentence is in passive voice, so it will simply take has + Past participle structure.
  • Correct sentence: My Uncle Samuel has been a source of inspiration for me since I was a young boy.

Hence, Option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Direction: The sentence is divided into four parts. Find out which part has an error and mark it as your answer. If there is no error, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Meenakshi and Arun (A) / must not opened (B) / the window at any cost. (C) / No error (D)
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'B'.

Key Points

  • The error lies in Part B of the sentence.
  • In a sentence, the use of a modal verb 'must' with the verb opened i.e. V2 or V3 form of the verb 'open' is incorrect.
  • The modal verb 'must' is used to express obligation, give orders and give advice.
    • Example: You must go to sleep now.
  • The modal verb 'must' is used with a negative to forbid someone to do something.
    • Example: All pupils must not bring a packed lunch tomorrow.
  • The first/ basic/root form of the verb follows the modal verb 'must' and its negative form 'must not'.
  • Therefore, the use of the verb 'opened' in Part B of the sentence should be replaced by its V1 form i.e. 'open'.
  • Hence, the correct answer is 'B'.
     

The Correct Sentence: Meenakshi and Arun must not open the window at any cost.

Additional Information

  • Modal verbs don't use an 's' for the third person singular.
  • Modal verbs make questions by inversion ('she can go' becomes 'can she go?').
  • Modal verbs are followed directly by the infinitive of another verb (without 'to').
  • Example:
    • It's snowing, so it must be very cold outside.
    • This bill can't be right.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

All residents are ______ that the entrance gate will be closed at 11 PM.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'hereby informed'.

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in the present simple passive voice.
  • The passive voice is often used to explain directions and instructions.
  • The passive is formed with be + past participle (3rd form of the verb).
  • In the present simple, the passive is: am / is / are + past participle (3rd form of the verb, here, informed).
  • Therefore, the past participle or third form of the verb (informed) should be used in the blank.
     

Hence, the correct answer is option 3.

Complete Sentence: All residents are hereby informed that the entrance gate will be closed at 11 PM.
Hinglish

  • दिया गया वाक्य वर्तमान सरल निष्क्रिय स्वर (present simple passive voice) में है ।
  • निष्क्रिय आवाज (passive voice) का उपयोग अक्सर दिशाओं और निर्देशों को समझाने के लिए किया जाता है।
  •  निष्क्रिय आवाज Be + past participle (क्रिया का तीसरा रूप) से बनता है ।
  • वर्तमान सरल में , निष्क्रिय है: am / is / are + past participle (क्रिया का तीसरा रूप, यहां, informed)।
  • इसलिए, रिक्त स्थान में क्रिया के पिछले कृदंत या तीसरे रूप (informed) का उपयोग किया जाना चाहिए।

अत: सही उत्तर विकल्प 3 है ।

पूर्ण वाक्य: All residents are hereby informed that the entrance gate will be closed at 11 PM.

quiz.text:
Directions: Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

You really need ______ some guidance in Chemistry.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'to take'.

Key Points

  • "Need" is usually used with an infinitive or an object + an infinitive. "Need" is followed by active or passive "to-infinitives" to express active or passive meanings, respectively.
  • Therefore, "to-infinitive" should be used in the blank.
  • Let us explore the given options:
    • 'To take' is the to-infinitive verb form.
    • 'Take' is the base form of the verb.
    • 'To be taking' is the progressive or continuous infinitives.
    • 'Taking' is the present participle or gerund form of the verb.
 

Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

Complete Sentence: You really need to take some guidance in Chemistry.

quiz.text:
Fill in the blank by choosing the best option:

The dead mouse, stinking from the length of time it had _______ about the fields, was the shabbiest the Kite could bring.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option 2, i.e., lain.

 Explanation:

  •  The sentence uses the auxiliary verb 'had' before the blank.
  •  This suggests that the tense is past perfect tense; and the main verb must be in its past participle form.
  •  The sentence talks about the dead mouse being 'about the fields', so it must be 'lying' about the fields.

 Main Point:

  •  To lie- (of a person or animal) be in or assume a horizontal or resting position. 
  •  The past participle form of the verb 'To lie' is 'lain'. So, the correct verb here must be 'lain'.

 Confusion Point:
 Let's look at the other options to be clear:

  •  Lay- (simple present tense form of 'To Lay') - put down and set in position for use. e.g. They asked us to lay the flowers on the grave.
  •  Lied- (past tense, past participle form of 'To Lie') - tell a lie or lies. e.g. He lied to us about the robbery.
  •  Laid- (past tense, past participle form of 'To Lay') - put down and set in position for use. e.g. We laid the flowers on the grave. 

​Thus, the complete sentence is: The dead mouse, stinking from the length of time it had lain about the fields, was the shabbiest the Kite could bring.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate option to improve the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to improve it, select ‘No improvement required’.

She caught him to steal money from her purse.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is: stealing

Key Points

  • Replace 'to steal' with 'stealing' to make the sentence correct.
  • Some verbs have different meanings depending on whether they are followed by an -ing form or to + infinitive. 
  • The -ing form emphasises the verb itself. (steal+ing)
  • The to-infinitive puts the emphasis more on the preference for, or the results of, the action.
  • We use 'to' with verbs to indicate the person or thing that receives or experiences the object of the verb.
  • Here, in the given sentence 'stealing' should be used because She caught him, when he was stealing. That means the two actions happened at the same time.

​Therefore, the correct answer is option 4.

Corrected sentence: She caught him stealing money from her purse.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. If there is no need to substitute it, select ‘No substitution required’. 

Karan looked everywhere for the pen-drive but could not find it.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'No substitution required'.

Key Points

  •  Could is a modal and modals always follow the first form of the verb. 
  • It has no tense, no participles, and no infinitive form.
  • Could is used as the past tense of can when it means that someone had the ability to do something.
    • For Example : I couldn't find my keys this morning.

Additional Information

  •  As mentioned above could have no tense forms and is followed by an infinitive without 'to'.
  •  In option 1 (Had + V1) is the wrong usage of grammar.

  Therefore, the given sentence is correct - Karan looked everywhere for the pen drive but could not find it.

quiz.text:
Choose the best option to transform into a 'Complex' sentence

In spite of being rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.
options: (A) As he is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.
(B) Though he is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is not hardworking and compassionate.
(C) Though he is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.
(D) He is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.
quiz.solution:
The correct option is 3) i.e. Though he is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.

Key Points

  • The simple sentence using “in spite of/ despite”, is converted into a complex sentence by adding “though/ although” in the sentence.
    • ​Example (Simple Sentence): In spite of being rich, she is hard working.
    • Example (Complex Sentence): Though she is rich, she is hard working. 
  • ​Option 3, is correct as 'though' has been used in place of 'In spite' while forming the complex sentence. ✔️
  • Option 1, is incorrect as 'As' has been used in place of 'In spite'. ❌
  • Option 2, the sentence is negative in nature, with the use of 'not hardworking and compassionate' which changes the sense of the sentence. ❌
  • Option 4, is incorrect as 'in spite' has not been used while forming the complex sentence. ❌​

Correct sentence: Though he is rich and endowed with almost unlimited wealth, he is hardworking and compassionate.

quiz.text:
Change this complex sentence into a compound sentence.
As Laura was displeased, she left the job.
options: (A) Laura left the job because she was displeased.
(B) Laura was displeased so she left the job
(C) Laura is displeased so she left the job
(D) Laura will be displeased because she left her job
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Laura was displeased so she left the job" 

Key Points

  • The given sentence is a complex sentence, we have to change it into a compound sentence.
  • The context is that Laura was displeased with the job that's why she left the job.
  • The reason for leaving the job is that Laura was displeased with the job.
  • When we break this complex sentence, we get two sentences:
    • As laura was displeased.
    • She left the job.
  • When "As" is used in a complex sentence, we use "so"  to combine both sentences.

Hence, the correct answer: Laura was displeased so she left the job


Additional Information.

  • Compound sentence: A compound sentence consists of two main clauses of equal importance, joined together with a conjunction.
    • I like coffee and she likes tea.
  • Complex sentence: A complex sentence consists of an independent clause and one or more dependent clauses.
    • I am glad to know that he had succeeded.

quiz.text: Fill the gap with the appropriate phrasal verb or preposition in the given sentence. The cost of living has run _______ considerably.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'up'.

Key Points

  • The word, 'up' is a preposition.
  • We use up to talk about a higher position or movement to a higher position.
    • E.g.- Ravi is already up. (= Ravi is out of bed.)
      • He is going up to China.

Hence, the correct answer is 'up'.

Additional Information

  • 'Out' is used to show movement away from the inside of a place or container.
    • E.g.- I jumped out of bed and ran downstairs.
  • 'Off' is used to indicate down or away from a place, position, or time, especially the present place, position, or time.
    • ​E.g.- He fell off his bike.

quiz.text:
Fill the gap with the appropriate phrasal verb or preposition in the given sentence.

He turned ________ to be a gangster.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'out'.

Key Points

  • The phrase 'turn out to be' is used to mean to happen in a particular way or to have a particular result, especially an unexpected one.
  • By reading the above-given sentence, we can see the most likely/ intended meaning of the given sentence is that he was found to be a gangster, which apparently was not expected.
  • So, the correct choice for the word to fill the blank is 'out' and the correct sentence: 'He turned out to be a gangster.'

Hence, Option 1 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  • turn (something) off ⇒ switch off.
  • turn (something) on ⇒ switch on; make someone feel interested or excited.

quiz.text:
Find the correct active voice for the given sentence in passive voice from the given alternatives.

Let the windows be closed.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Close the windows'.

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in the Passive Voice. As per the given question we have to change the sentence into Active Form. 
  • The given sentence is an example of an 'Imperative Sentence'. 
  • The structure of these kinds of sentences is:
    • V1 + object. (Active Voice)
    • Let + object + be + V3. (Passive Voice) 
    • Example:
      • Speak the truth. (Active voice)
      • Let the truth be spoken. (Passive voice)
  • Hence, the correct active voice will be- Close the windows.

​Hence, the correct answer is Option 3.​Important Points

  • ​When an action performed by the subject is expressed by the verb, it is an active voice. 

  • Active Voice example:

    • Hens lay eggs.
    • Birds build nests.
  • When the action expressed by the verb is received by the subject, it is passive voice.
  • Passive Voice Examples:

    • Eggs are laid by hens.
      Nests are built by birds.

quiz.text:
Direction: Select the correct active/passive form from the given sentence.

The professors will ask me tough questions on Elizabethan literature in the interview.
options: (A) I would be asked tough questions on Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.
(B) I will be asked tough questions on Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.
(C) I will be asking tough questions on Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.
(D) I will be asked tough questions from Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option 2) i.e.  'I will be asked tough questions on Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.'

Key Points 

  • The given sentence is in the active voice. We have to change the sentence into passive form. 
  • The given sentence is written in the future indefinite tense form. 
  • The structure of these kinds of sentences is:
    • Active Voice: Subject + will + V1 + Object.
    • Passive Voice: Object + will + be + V3 + by + Subject.
  • Let’s see an example:
    • Active voice: They will eat Chinese food for dinner.
    • Passive voice: Chinese food will be eaten by them for dinner.
  • The subject of the given sentence is 'The professors' and the object of the given sentence is 'me.'
  • So, in the passive voice, the position of ‘subject’ and ‘object’ will be interchanged. 
  • Here, 'will ask' will be changed into 'will be asked.'
  • Also here, 'me' will be changed into 'I.'
  • Add 'by' before the subject.

 

Correct Sentence: I will be asked tough questions on Elizabethan literature by the professors in the interview.

quiz.text:
Choose the appropriate prepositional phrase for the given sentence.

The college results have been good ______our expectations
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'contrary to'.

Key Points     

  • Contrary to means emphasizing that something unexpected is true.
    • For example:- Contrary to expectations, women, and men living alone did not have a larger friendship network than married or partnered couples living together.
  • Contrary by is an incorrect prepositional phrase as contrary is used with the preposition to not by which means emphasizing that something unexpected is true.
  • Contrary with is again an incorrect prepositional phrase as contrary is used with the preposition to not with which means emphasizing that something unexpected is true.
  • Contrary in is again an incorrect prepositional phrase as contrary is used with the preposition in not to which means emphasizing that something unexpected is true.
  • By referring to the above explanation, it can be concluded that contrary to should be the appropriate option to be chosen for filling the blank.

Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text:
Choose the appropriate prepositional phrase for the given sentence:
The little boy was continually ______ the toys ______ the shop.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'knocking over, in'.

Key Points  

  • Knocking over means to push or strike someone or something, causing the person or the thing to fall.
    • For example:-  He accidentally knocks over a vase.
  • In the given sentence, we are talking about the little boy who was continually pushing or striking toys and causing them to fall in the shop.
  • As the toys are in the shop that's why in is the appropriate preposition to be chosen for filling the 2nd blank.
  • Tripping over means to fall over, to stumble on, to slip on something. 
  • Falling down means (of a person) lose one's balance and collapse.
  • Breaking up means disintegrate or disperse; (of a gathering) come to an end and disperse.
  • By referring to the above explanation, it can be concluded that 'knocking over, in' is the appropriate option to be chosen for filling the blank.

Hence, the correct answer is option 4.

quiz.text:
Select the one, which best expresses the same sentence in Indirect / Direct speech.

Teacher said to children, "Have you prepared well for the finals?"
options: (A) Teacher asked the children whether they have prepared well for the finals.
(B) Teacher asked the children whether they have been preparing well for the finals.
(C) Teacher asked the children if they did prepare well for the finals.
(D) Teacher asked the children if they had prepared well for the finals.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Teacher asked the children if they had prepared well for the finals."

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in direct speech so it will be changed to indirect speech.
  • There are a few rules when changing a sentence from direct to indirect speech.
    • If the reporting verb is in the past tense of the direct speech, the tense of the sentence will change in indirect speech.
    • The given sentence is in the present tense in direct speech so it will change to the past tense in indirect speech.
    • The auxiliary verb "have" in direct speech will change to "had" in indirect speech.
    • The interrogative sentence in the direct speech will have the conjunction "if or whether" in the direct speech.
    • The second-person pronoun "you" in direct speech will change to the third-person pronoun "they" in indirect speech.
  • Only option 4 has the correct indirect speech sentence.

Hence, the correct answer is option 4.

quiz.text:
Select the correct Indirect Narration of the given sentence.

My friend said, "What a beautiful bungalow you have!"
options: (A) My friend exclaimed that he had a very beautiful bungalow.
(B) My friend said that I had a very beautiful bungalow
(C) My friend exclaimed that I had a very beautiful bungalow
(D) My friend exclaimed that what a beautiful bungalow I had.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'My friend exclaimed that I  had a very beautiful bungalow'.

Key Points

  • Here, the direct speech in the Present Perfect Tense.
  • The given sentence is an exclamatory sentence. So, with this 'said' will be substituted with 'exclaimed that'.
  • We will remove the Inverted Comma and Comma in the indirect narration.
  • The tense in indirect speech will be Past Perfect tense - Had+ V3.
  • Hence, the indirect narration is 'My friend exclaimed that I had a very beautiful bungalow'.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option 3.

quiz.text:
Identify the correct sentence pattern of the given sentence:

Occasionally, he becomes restless.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "A+S+V+C."

Key Points

  • The subject is a noun, noun phrases, or pronoun that usually comes before the main verb. It also represents the person or thing that acts as the verb, or about which something is stated.
  • Verb, is a word or group of words that describes an action or state.
  • A complement tells us something about the nature of the subject or the object.(She is happy.)
  • An adjunct is an adverb or a phrase that adds meaning to the verb in a sentence or part of a sentence. (She writes beautifully.)
  • Now, in the given sentence, it can be concluded that:
    • "Occasionally" is the adjunct which explains more about the verb in the sentence i.e. "becomes."
    • "He" is the subject.
    • "Restless" is the complement in the sentence, as it tells us more about the subject.
  • Thus, it can be concluded that the correct sentence pattern is "A+S+V+C."

Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text:
Identify the correct sentence pattern of the given sentence:

He painted the house yellow.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "S+V+O+C."

Key Points

  • Systematic arrangement of words in a sentence meaningfully is called a sentence pattern.
  • Following are the basic elements of a sentence:
    • The subject is a noun, noun phrases, or pronoun that usually comes before the main verb. It also represents the person or thing that acts as the verb, or about which something is stated.
    • Verb, is a word or group of words that describes an action or state.
    • A Direct Object refers to the person or thing affected by the action of the verb. (He bought a bat.)
    • An indirect object usually refers to the person who 'benefits' from the action of the verb. (He bought her a bat.)
    • A complement tells us something about the nature of the subject or the object.(She is happy.)
    • An adjunct is an adverb or a phrase that adds meaning to the verb in a sentence or part of a sentence. (She writes beautifully.)
  • Now, in the given sentence, it can be concluded that:
    • "He" is the subject.
    • "Painted" is the verb.
    • "The house" is the object.
    • "Yellow" is the complement as it tells us more about the object i.e. the house.
  • Thus, it can be concluded that the correct sentence pattern is "S+V+O+C."

Hence, the correct answer is option 3.

quiz.text:
Direction: Choose the option with the appropriate punctuation inserted for the given sentence.

The Election Commission EC has announced the date for the general elections
options: (A) The Election Commission EC has announced the date for the general election?
(B) The Election Commission (EC) has announced the date for the general elections.
(C) the election commission, (EC) has announced the date for the general elections!
(D) The election commission (ec) has announced the date for the general elections.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'The Election Commission (EC) has announced the date for the general elections.'

Key Points

  • The given sentence is a declarative sentence, so we can't use a question mark ( ? ) or exclamation mark ( ! ) at the end of the sentence.
  • So options 1 and 3 are incorrect.
  • The full stop ( . ) represents the greatest pause and separation and it is used to mark the end of a declarative or an Imperative sentence.
    • Example: Dear, patient, gentle, Nell was dead.
  • ​So, we must use a full stop ( . ) at the end of the sentence.
  • We use commas( , ) to separate independent clauses when they are joined by any of these seven coordinating conjunctions: and, but, for, or, nor, so, yet.
    • Example: I love vanilla ice cream, but my brother prefers chocolate.
  • We don't need to use a comma ( , ) between "Election Commission" and its abbreviation "EC."
  • ​Therefore, the correct answer is Option 2.
    ​

Correct sentence: The Election Commission (EC) has announced the date for the general elections.

quiz.text:
Choose the option that best punctuates the given sentence:

He said i will do it now
options: (A) He said I will do it now.
(B) He said, I will do it now.
(D) He said, "I will do it now."
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is He said, "I will do it now."

Key Points

  • Punctuation is the use of symbols such as full stops or periods, commas, or question marks to divide written words into sentences and clauses.
  • The statement given in the question is in direct speech.
  • In direct speech, we usually put a comma between the reporting clause and the reported clause.
    • The reporting clause in the statement is 'He said' and 'I will do it now.'
    • Thus, a comma (,) will be used in between the reporting and the reported clause.
  • The words of the original speaker are enclosed in inverted commas, either single ('…') or double (“…”).
    • Thus, the reported clause will be enclosed in inverted commas.
  • Full Stops and commas are always written inside the quotation marks.
  • From the above explanation, it is clear that the correct statement is: He said, "I will do it now."

Hence, the correct answer is option 4.

quiz.text: Who is Griffin in the story 'Footprints without Feet''?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "The scientist."

Key Points

  • Griffin was a very accomplished scientist who had found a mysterious medicine that might render humans invisible.
  • As a result, Griffin was transformed into an arrogant criminal as he disobeyed the law multiple times, which was never justified. 
  • His deeds demonstrate how catastrophic science is when it is in the devil's hands.

Therefore, Option 2 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: At whom was the invisible man angry for asking an explanation for the mysterious happenings?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Mrs. Hall."

Key Points

  • The invisible man became enraged at Mrs. Hall for wanting an account of the strange events.
  • He removed everything he had on his head, leaving him without anything or his head.
  • The invisible man quickly threw away all of his garments to become unseen, but when constable Jaffers approached to capture him, he was beaten senseless; however, he managed to flee.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Griffin was an outlaw in what way?
options: (A) He ran out of the London store
(C) He had engaged in numerous antisocial acts
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is, "He had engaged in numerous antisocial acts."

Key Points

  • Griffin was unruly since he had committed many anti-social acts without feeling bad about them.
  • He fled after torching his landlord's house and stealing groceries and clothing from a London store.
  • He stole cash from a clergyman's home to cover his expenses.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Where did Griffin decide to slip after he realized it was difficult to wander around without clothes in London winter?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "A big London store."

Key Points

  • Griffin decided to sneak into a large London store as it was winter, and it was getting harder to get around London without clothing.
  • By the time, the store staff  had arrived , Griffin had failed to wake up. 
  • The assistants pursued Griffin as he fled in a state of terror and had to throw off his just-discovered garments to disappear and run.

Therefore, Option 2 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the reaction of the two boys in London after they saw fresh muddy footprints?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "surprised and fascinated ."

Key Points

  • After noticing the new muddy tracks on a house's steps, the two boys were surprised and fascinated.
  • The two boys could see the muddy tracks, but the barefoot figure was not apparent. 
  • Before stepping in some mud and leaving his footsteps behind, Griffin was undetectable.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was Amanda supposed to finish?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Her homework."

Key Points

  • Amanda needed to complete her homework.
  • However, she wanted to be left alone as she floated happily on a luscious, emerald sea.
  • She  wish to never leave the calm environment ; without instructions or tasks to complete.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What distinguishes the Bengal Tiger from other species?
options: (D) Black stripes on his yellow body
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "black stripes on his yellow body."

Key Points

  • The Bengal Tiger is a magnificent and stunning creature; his skin has a golden tint.
  • He has black stripes across the length of his body and has great agility.
  • He instantly devours anything that catches his attention. 

Therefore, Option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who else was there in the Seagull's family except him?
options: (A) His father, mother and a sister
(B) His father and mother, two brothers and a sister
(C) His father, mother and two brothers
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "His father and mother, two brothers, and a sister."

Key Points

  • Except for himself, his family consisted of his mother and father, two brothers, and a sister.
  • The seagull was the youngest and believed that his wings couldn't support him because they were so frail. 
  • Even after all of his siblings had jumped, he couldn't muster the courage to do so.

Therefore, option 2 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Why is the 10th of May 1994 significant for South Africa?
options: (B) First ever president of the country was elected
(C) Elections for the first democratic non-racial government
(D) Constitution of South Africa was formed
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "​Elections for the first democratic non-racial government."

Key Points

  • The 10th of May 1994 is significant in South Africa because it marks the date of the country's first democratic, non-racial electoral process. 
  • Nelson Mandela was elected as South Africa's first black president.
  • Many global leaders and officials gathered to honor the new administration on this day.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Why was Lencho staring at the sky?
options: (B) He was looking at the flying birds
(C) He was hoping for the rain
(D) He was asking for help from god
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is, "He was hoping for the rain."

Key Points

  • Lencho remained to stare at the sky, hoping for rain. 
  • The hailstones severely damaged Lencho's crops. 
  • He was afraid his family would suffer from hunger.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Where was the child taken by his parents?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "fair."

Key Points

  • The child and his parents went to a fair.
  • He desired things like garlands, balloons, and candy over there. 
  • He also wanted to look at the snake and play on the swings.

Therefore, Option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the reason due to which Lushkoff could not go to Kaluga?
options: (B) He had red spots on one of the cheeks
(C) He looked familiar to Sergei
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "​He had no money."

Key Points

  • Lushkoff was unable to travel to Kaluga as he lacked the necessary funds.
  • He felt embarrassed to ask; however, he was obliged to do so owing to unexpected events.
  • Lushkoff lied to others to obtain handouts.
  • He sometimes claimed that he had been a former teacher for about eight years.

Therefore, Option 1 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What did the author lose in the fire?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "all his belongings."

Key Points

  • All of the author's possessions had been destroyed by the fire.
  • The author felt humiliated as he did not have a uniform, books, or school bag.
  • He went around the school blandly as though all the shelter and safety had been snatched away from him.

Therefore, Option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: About whom did Sue want to talk about to Mr. Behrman?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Johnsy."

Key Points

  • Sue wanted to visit Mr. Behrman to express her concerns about Johnsy. 
  • She informed him of Johnsy's strange premonition that she would die after the last leaf fell.
  • As the leaves began to fall, Johnsy started feeling down.
  • She believed she could die as the final leaf of the creeper would shed.

Therefore, Option 1 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who showed up on the old lady's door?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "St. Peter."

Key Points

  • St. Peter knocked on the old lady's door while she was baking a cake.
  • The man had gotten weak from starving and traveling and was on the lookout for food.
  • Saint Peter, a wise saint, became enraged and condemned the elderly lady for her greed.

Therefore, Option 4 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who wrote the poem "The Lake Isle of Innisfree"?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "W. B. Yeats."

Key Points

  • W. B. Yeats wrote the poem "The Lake Isle of Innisfree."
  • W. B. Yeats eloquently depicts an island within the lake of Innisfree as a very calm spot with natural beauty.
  • Yeats recounts several facets of its allure, from the diverse insects and birds to the glowing light at various moments of the day.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the reason Kezia’s father punished her?
options: (B) Kezia tore her father's speech
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Kezia tore her father's speech."

Key Points

  • Kezia was punished for shredding the pages because they contained her father's remarks.
  • She stuffed the papers into the pin cushion as a gift for her father. 
  • Kezia's father was hostile and yelled all the time aggressively. 

Therefore, option 2 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: At what age was Evelyn’s deafness confirmed?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "11."

Key Points

  • Evelyn's deafness was discovered at the age of eleven after she was examined by a doctor.
  • Isabel questioned Evelyn's partial deafness, as she didn't respond when called to play the piano.
  • However, Evelyn slowly lost her hearing ability owing to a nerve injury when she was just 8, which was confirmed later.

Therefore, Option 3 is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the condition of the book that Tommy showed to Margie?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "An old book."

Key Points

  • Tommy showed Margie an old, original, and actual book.
  • The book was once owned by Tommy's grandfather.
  • The book had wrinkled and yellowed pages.

Therefore, Option 1 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  • Tommy could easily differentiate the book, as it was different from Tommy's telebooks.

quiz.text: Whom did Princess September marry?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is King of Cambodia.Key Points

  • Princess September grew very beautiful and got married to the King of Cambodia.
  • Her sisters were ugly and were married to the king's councilors.
  • She was carried on a white elephant all the way to the city in which the King lived.
  • The lesson “Princess September” by Somerset Maugham revolves around the youngest daughter of the King and Queen of Siam named 'September'. 

          Thus, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: With whom, the poet has compared the child in the poem 'The School Boy'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A caged bird.Key Points

  • The poet compares a child in school as a bird in a cage.
  • He thus says that as a bird is unhappy in the cage so is a child in school.
  • He says that a child who is scared by his parents and teachers cannot be happy and joyful.
  • Like a caged bird, the boy is also not free to do any thing at his own will. He wants to lead a life of freedom but he can't because there are many restrictions on him.

           Thus, 'option 1' is the correct answer. Additional Information

  • "The School Boy" is a 1789 poem by William Blake and published as a part of his poetry collection entitled Songs of Experience.
  • It is a poem written in the pastoral tradition that focuses on the downsides of formal learning.

quiz.text: Who is the poet of the poem 'The Last Bargain'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Rabindranath Tagore.Key Points

  • The Last Bargain  is written by Rabindranath Tagore.
  • It is about the story of a man who is in search of a job. He wants a job in which he can work without losing his freedom.
  • It also revolves around the theme of freedom and self-satisfaction that a human being needs.
  • The moral of the poem is that money, wealth, power or beauty cannot give you happiness.

           Hence, 'option 2' is the correct answer. Additional Information

  • Rabindranath Tagore was a Bengali polymath who worked as a poet, writer, playwright, composer, philosopher, social reformer and painter.
  • He reshaped Bengali literature and music as well as Indian art with Contextual Modernism in the late 19th and early 20th century.

quiz.text: Bipin Babu had never been to-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Ranchi. Key Points

  • Bepin Babu had never been to Ranchi. He had been at the point of going several times, but never made it.
  • Bepin Babu hesitated to visit Mr. Mukerji thinking that it would be ridiculous if he had really visited Ranchi.
  • Mukerji would think Bepin Babu had gone mad. Hence, Bepin Babu finally decided to phone him instead of going to meet him.

          Therefore, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Find a word in 'A Short Monsoon Diary' which means ‘curses’.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Imprecations.Key Points

  • An imprecation is something rude, angry, or hostile that is said to or about someone.
  • It means a spoken curse.
  • In the story, it has been used for  Bijju's mother as she started cursing the leopard.
  • The leopard attacked Bijju's cows.

           Thus, 'option 2' is the correct answer.​ Additional Information

  • Crevices means narrow openings or cracks in rock or wall.
  • Ravine means valley.
  • Heralded means announced or brought the news of.

quiz.text: Who said, “kissa khatam, paisa hazam”?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is The old coin.Key Points

  • The oldest coin was pleading the boy to spend the coins on jalebis.
  • By saying,“Kissa khatam, paisa hazam,” it was attempting to persuade him that he should buy jalebis with the money for the fees and pay the fees with the scholarship money.
  • The phrase "Kissa khatam" means 'story ends' and "paisa hazam" means 'money disappeared' or money digested by consuming jalebis. 

          Hence, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Whom did Dr. Wilson and Mill support?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Jody.Key Points

  • Dr. Wilson and Mill supported Jody to bring the fawn back home.
  • Jody's father was bitten by a snake and Jody had killed a doe to use its heart and liver to take out poison out of his father.
  • The doe was orphaned  and Jody was worried about it.
  • He wanted to bring it home and raise it.

           Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: "I began work on it on Christmas Eve”. In the above sentence ‘it’ stands for-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A roller desk.Key Points

  • The given line is taken from the story "The Best Christmas Present In The World" by Michael Morpurgo.
    In a junk shop in Bridport, the author spotted a roll-top desk.
  • Though it was in poor condition - the roll-top in several pieces, one leg clumsily mended and scorch marks all down one side, the author wanted to buy and restore it.
  • He started working on it on the Eve of Christmas in order to restore it.

          Therefore, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: How was Kari treated?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer Like a baby.Key Points

  • Kari was like a baby as he had to be trained to be good.
  • When narrator was a little boy, he could reach Kari's back if he stood on tiptoe.
  • Both of them grew together and the narrator probably didn't know how tall Kari was. 

          Therefore, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: The time period for a grub to become a complete ant is-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Five to six weeks.Key Points

  • The given question is based on the chapter 'The Tiny Teacher'. 
  • It takes five to six weeks for a grub to become a complete ant.
  • Two or three weeks later, grubs become cocoons and lie without food or activity for three weeks more.
  • Then the cocoons break and perfect ants appear.

           Hence, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: The reason of Mr. Gessler's death was -
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Slow starvation. Key Points

  • The Englishman took over Mr. Gessler's shop who told the narrator about Mr. Gessler's struggle and his failure.
  • Due to lack of advertisement, ultimately he starved to death.
  • He used to devote himself to shoe making so much that he used to forget about everything else.

          Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What did an old man do in 'The Ashes That Made Trees Bloom'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A rice farmer.Key Points

  • The old man was a farmer. He was a rice farmer and he went daily with hoe or spade into the fields.
  • This story is about an old couple and their beloved pet dog.
  • The couple were poor but hardworking and affectionate to everyone around them, including the neighbors who were troublesome and cruel. 

          Therefore, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the name of little kitty in "A Gift of Chappals"?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Mahendran.Key Points

  • The little kitty's name was Mahendravarma Pallava Poonai.
  • The short for of its name is Mahendran.
  • The kitten was named as Mahendravarman pallava poonai because Ravi felt that it was a descendant of the emblem of Pallava kings as its fur looked like a lion's mane. 

          Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: According to the chapter, 'The Wonder Called Sleep', A dream -
options: (A) Is the activity of the heart
(B) Is not the activity of the heart
(C) Is the activity of the soul
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Is not the activity of the heart.Key Points

  • A dream is an activity of mind when we asleep.
  • Our heart keeps working when we sleep.
  • Dreams can help us to sleep through noise.
  • Our heartbeat also slows down when we sleep.

           Thus, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Which poem has been used in the ending of the 'The Wonder Called Sleep'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Lights Out.Key Points

  • 'The Wonder Called Sleep' chapter has a poem written in ending.
  • The poem 'Lights Out' is written by "Edward Thomas".
  • The Wonder Called Sleep Summary tells us about the importance of sleep and how it helps us in making us feel refreshed. 
  • In the poem, the poet describes the concept of sleep at its best. It makes us wonder at the beauty and the mysterious nature of sleep.

          Therefore, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: The farmer's wife felt sorry -
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is For her hasty decision.Key Points

  • The farmer's wife saw the snake  in pieces. Her own son was safely asleep.
  • She realized her mistake. She felt very sorry.
  • She got angry on the mongoose without knowing the truth.
  • She regretted her decision afterwards.

          Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What are the loveliest things mentioned in the poem 'The Wonderful Words'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Great ideas.Key Points

  • The poet encourages readers to convert their thoughts into words and speak them as these are the loveliest things that never had been said.
  • People are constantly trying to translate their thoughts into words.
  • The poet wants these attempts to continue.
  • The Wonderful Words  talks about how our thoughts are precious and are in the prison of mind.

           Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the reason of a quarrel between siblings in poem "The Quarrel"?
quiz.solution:
the correct answer is Over a petty issue.Key Points

  • The poet is trying to explain how a quarrel between two brothers began and ended without any reason.
  • The poet says that he quarreled with his brother over something and he was not even aware what he was quarreling about.
  • One thing led to another and while fighting both of them fell down.

           Therefore, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: The dog was surprised when he saw-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is The lion in fear.Key Points

  • The dog was surprised because he came know that the man was stronger than the lion.
  • The lion was afraid after seeing the man coming .
  • The story is of a dog who wanted to serve the strongest master on earth as it was tired of wandering here and there for food and shelter.
  • So it started reaching out to many animals.
  • In the end, he found that humans are  the most powerful beings.
  • So, he decided to work for the human and gets domesticated.

           Therefore, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Little man’s face wrinkled like a dish-cloth’ shows his emotions-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Of anger.Key Points

  • The little man was an elf. He had not studied Maths or English.
  • He got angry when called upon to do Patrick's homework.
  • 'Who Did Patrick's Homework' is about the story of a boy who does not like his homework at all. 
  • The moral of this story is hard work is only the key to success.
  • We should always do our work on our own.
  • Patrick learnt this value and started to do his homework.

          Therefore, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: In the chapter, 'Fair Play' , the old lady was-
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is ​Jumman's aunt.Key Points

  • The story 'Fair Play' revolves around the lives of two friends with a fair sense of justice.
  • Jumman Shaikh and Algu Chaudhary are good friends.
  • They are famous for their loyalty and service to each other.
  • Jumman's aunt, an old lady, transfers her property to Jumman only if he agrees to take care of her.

          Hence, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who said “Paper has more patience than people”.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Anne Frank".

Key Points

  •  Anne Frank wrote, "Paper has more patience than people." 
  • For Anne Frank, keeping a diary was an unusual experience because she had never kept one before receiving one as a present for her 13th birthday.
  • She regarded it as her best friend, someone she could always rely on and with whom she could share all of her highs and lows.
  • Anne believed that the paper had more time than individuals to consider her situation. As a result, she found it simpler to put all of her thoughts on paper.
  • Nobody else was supposed to read her private journal.

Therefore, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text: Who is the narrator of the story “The Black Aeroplane”?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "A pilot".

Key Points

  • “The Black Aeroplane” is a short story by Frederick Forsyth.
  • The story The Black Aeroplane's narrator is a pilot.
  • He elaborates on his error of judgment and how it leads to issues.
  • In the lesson, the pilot is dreaming of his family's holiday while flying from Paris to London. After passing through Paris, he notices the gloomy skies that indicate an impending storm.
  • He should have turned back to Paris for his protection, but he made a different choice. He risked the lives of the passengers and piloted the jet into a storm in order to enjoy a holiday.

Therefore, the correct answer is option 3.

quiz.text: Which of the following national anthems were played during the inauguration ceremony of the first Black President of South Africa?
options:
(A)

Nkosi Sikelel -iAfrika and Die Stem

(B)

The Star-Spangled Banner and Die Stem

(C)

Jan Gan Man and The Star-Spangled Banner

(D)

Amar Sonar Bangla and Nkosi Sikelel –iAfrika
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Nkosi Sikelel -iAfrika and Die Stem".

 Key Points

  • The first Black president of South Africa was Nelson Mandela.
  • In "Long Walk to Freedom", an excerpt from Mandela's autobiography he talks about the inauguration after Mr. Mandela's African National Congress(ANC) won the elections.
  • Liberating people from the bonds of poverty, squalor, and suffering was one of Nelson Mandela's main goals. Additionally, he established the ideal of a society free from gender or racial prejudice.

  • Two national anthems were sung on the auspicious occasion of the inauguration, one by the Whites and the other by the Blacks to represent the equality of the two races.

  • Because he believes that an oppressor is a victim of hatred who is imprisoned by prejudice and narrow-mindedness, Mandela does not believe that the oppressor is free. He comes to understand that the humanity and peace of both the oppressor and the oppressed are stolen.

Therefore, the correct answer is option 1.

quiz.text: Why did Lencho write a letter to God?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is "Because his crops failed".

Key Points

  • "A Letter to God" is a short story by G.L. Fuentes.
  • Lencho, is a farmer who writes a letter to God when his crops fail.
  • Lencho wished for favorable rain because a good harvest required it.
  • Huge hailstones started to fall along with the rain as a strong wind started to blow.
  • Due to the weather, Lencho's field's whole crop production was destroyed. 

Therefore, the correct answer is option 2.

quiz.text: Kalpana Chawla was an astronaut at ________.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is ‘NASA.’

Key Points

  • NASA stands for National Aeronautics and Space Administration.
  • It is an independent agency of the US Federal government used for civil space programs and scientific discoveries.
  • Kalpana Chawla was an Indian-born American astronaut at NASA.
  • She was born in Karnal, Haryana.
  • She was the first woman of Indian origin to go to space.

So, option 1 is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Read the poem carefully and answer the questions given below-

I saw a snake and ran away...

Some snakes are dangerous, they say;

But mother says that kind is good,

And eats up insects for his food.

So when he wiggles in the grass I’ll stand aside and watch him pass,

And tell myself, “There’s no mistake,

It’s just a harmless garden snake!”

What lesson did the poet learn?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is To stand aside quietly.Key Points

  •  According to the poet, all snakes are dangerous, so, he was very scared of them and runs away .
  • His fear regarding snakes vanishes when his mother tells him that not all snakes are dangerous ; some are harmless too.
  • In the end, he learns that he should stand aside quietly instead of running away from the snake.

          Hence, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Read the poem carefully and answer the questions given below-

I saw a snake and ran away...

Some snakes are dangerous, they say;

But mother says that kind is good,

And eats up insects for his food.

So when he wiggles in the grass I’ll stand aside and watch him pass,

And tell myself, “There’s no mistake,

It’s just a harmless garden snake!”

Identify the poetic device- Some snakes are dangerous, they say.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Alliteration.Key Points

  • Alliteration is the repetition of an initial consonant sound in words that are in close proximity to each other.
  • In the given line, the sound of consonant 's' has been repeated such as 'some' 'say' and 'snake in a single line.

           Therefore, 'option 3' is the correct answer.​ Additional Information

  • A simile is a figure of speech that describes something to be something else, but uses the words “like” or “as” .
  • A metaphor is a figure of speech that directly refers to one thing by mentioning another. 
  • Hyperbole is a figure of speech that uses an exaggerated or extravagant statement to create a strong emotional response.

quiz.text:
Read the poem carefully and answer the questions given below-

I saw a snake and ran away...

Some snakes are dangerous, they say;

But mother says that kind is good,

And eats up insects for his food.

So when he wiggles in the grass I’ll stand aside and watch him pass,

And tell myself, “There’s no mistake,

It’s just a harmless garden snake!”

What does the poet mean by ‘There’s no mistake’?
options: (A) That there is no harm in standing near the snake
(D) That some snakes can make mistakes
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is That there is no harm in standing near the snake.Key Points

  • There's no mistake, It's just a harmless garden snake.” - shows a complete change of the child's attitude towards snakes. 
  • The young narrator, in his ignorance, had assumed all kinds of snakes to be dangerous.
  • However, from his mother he learnt that not every kind of snake is dangerous - only some are and most of them are not. 
  • This makes him peacefully admire the garden snake when he sees it next.
  • He realized that there is no harm in standing near the snake.

          Thus, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Read the poem carefully and answer the questions given below-

I saw a snake and ran away...

Some snakes are dangerous, they say;

But mother says that kind is good,

And eats up insects for his food.

So when he wiggles in the grass I’ll stand aside and watch him pass,

And tell myself, “There’s no mistake,

It’s just a harmless garden snake!”

What does the ‘wiggling’ of the snake mean?
options: (D)  Moving loftily his head left and right
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is  Moving loftily his head left and right.Key Points

  • The word 'wiggle' means move or cause to move up and down or from side to side with small rapid movements.
  • The snake wiggles in the grass. The speaker stands aside so that the snake may pass without seeing him.
  •  A snake has no legs or feet. So, it wiggles or moves on the surface.

           Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text:
Read the poem carefully and answer the questions given below-

I saw a snake and ran away...

Some snakes are dangerous, they say;

But mother says that kind is good,

And eats up insects for his food.

So when he wiggles in the grass I’ll stand aside and watch him pass,

And tell myself, “There’s no mistake,

It’s just a harmless garden snake!”

Who is the speaker of the poem?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is A child. Key Points

  • The speaker, a child, recalls an experience from his childhood during the course of the narrative.
  • The sight of a snake in the garden causes fear in him.
  • The child's mother tells him that the kind of the snake that he saw was not so dangerous.
  • It lived on insects  and did not harm others.

          Hence, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What was the result of the first day's fight in chapter 'The Fight'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Draw.Key Points

  • After the fight nobody of them emerged to be victorious.
  • Their bodies were exhausted.
  • They were making a lot of efforts to speak but they could only decide that the fight would continue the next day.
  • In the first round, the fight ended in a draw.

           Hence, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: The beggar was actually a _________ in Russian choir.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Singer.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from the story- 'The Beggar'.
  •  Lushkoff, the beggar, was a middle aged poor man.
  • He was a singer in the Russian choir but was sacked from his job due to his drinking habits.
  • He was not a bom beggar. 

          Thus, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who wrote 'A Slumber Did My Spirit Seal'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is William Wordsworth.

Key Points

  • "A slumber did my spirit seal" is a poem written by William Wordsworth in 1798 and published in the 1800 edition of Lyrical Ballads.
  • It talks about the death of the poet's beloved Lucy.
  • This poem reflects on the thinking and feeling of the poet regarding his beloved's death.
  • Her death has made the soul of the author a seal. 

          Hence, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: When did author go to Iraq in 'Mijbil the Otter'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 1956.Key Points

  •  The author had gone to Southern Iraq in the year 1956.
  • He took a fancy to the idea that instead of keeping a dog as a pet, he would go for an otter.
  • Camusfearna was surrounded by water so it would be an eminently suitable spot for this experiment.

          Therefore, 'option 4' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: When did Margie write the diary?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 2157.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from the chapter - The Fun They Had.
  • Margie wrote her diary in the year 2157 about how Tommy discovered a book.
  • Tommy's granddad wrote this book when he was a child.
  • Margie discovered that back in the day, all of the stories were printed on paper.

          Hence, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Who had come to open girls school in the village?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Tehsildar.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from the chapter Bholi.
  • Bholi was seven years old when Mangla was married.
  • The same year a primary school for girls was opened in their village.
  • The Tehsildar visited their village to inaugurate a girl's primary school.

           Thus, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Which author's lines are mentioned in the end of chapter 'My Childhood'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Khalil Gibran.Key Points

  • APJ Abdul Kalam's - 'My childhood' story starts with a few instances describing Kalam's childhood. 
  • When A.P.J Abdul Kalam's mother came to know that he wanted to go Ramanathapuram for higher studies, she got upset.
  • To console her, his father uttered few lines from “Your children” by Khalil Gibran.
  • He wanted to mean that your children are not your children of life.

           Thus, 'option 2' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What did Kisa ask for to bring her son's life?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Medicine.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from the chapter 'The Sermon at Benares'.
  • When Kisa Gotami's son died, she went from house to house.
  • She was asking for medicine that would cure her child.

          Thus, 'option 3' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: Horace had allergy from __________.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Smell of flowers.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from 'A Question of Trust'.
  • Horace suffered from hay fever and was allergic to some flowers.
  • On smelling the flowers, he started sneezing and was caught red-handed by another thief. 

          Thus, 'option 1' is the correct answer.

quiz.text: What problem does Mrs Pumphrey think that Tricki has?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Malnutrition.Key Points

  • The above question has been taken from the chapter 'A Triumph of Surgery'.
  • Mrs Pumphrey thought that Tricki was suffering from malnutrition as he was weak and listless.
  • So, she started to give him extra snacks like cod-liver oil and malt between the main meals and Horlicks after dinner to make him stronger.

          Hence, 'option 2' is the correct answer.
